title: Worked Solution
text: To determine whether the value $$y=\frac{1}{3}$$ is a solution to the equation $$9y+2=6y+3$$, we can substitute $$\frac{1}{3}$$ in for $$y$$ in the equation and see if the resulting equation is true. Substituting $$\frac{1}{3}$$ in for $$y$$ in the equation $$9y+2=6y+3$$, we get: $$9\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)+2=6\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)+3$$ Simplifying this equation, we get: $$3+2=2+3$$ This equation is true, so $$y=\frac{1}{3}$$ is a solution to the equation $$9y+2=6y+3$$.
